1.content: Design comprehensive database schema for street etymology website
1.details:
Create detailed database schema including:
- Core street data (names, coordinates, postal codes, local authority areas)
- Historical information (first recorded year, development periods, architecture)
- Charles Booth poverty guide integration with citations
- User authentication and profiles system
- Community contributions and contact posts
- Comprehensive citations system for all information sources
- Proper indexing and relationships

2.details:
Execute SQL migrations to create:
- Streets table with comprehensive fields
- Historical periods and architecture types
- Charles Booth poverty data
- User profiles and authentication
- Community features (posts, comments, contributions)
- Citations system with source tracking
- Spatial indexes for location queries

3.content: Set up sample data and test the schema
3.details:
Populate database with:
- Enhanced sample UK streets with all new fields
- Charles Booth poverty descriptions and sources
- Example citations for various fact types
- Test user accounts and community features
- Verify spatial queries and performance
